IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO EDUCATE AND ENERGIZE MEN AND WOMEN FOR EXCELLENCE IN LEADERSHIP, SCHOLARSHIP AND SERVICE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: BOLDLY INFORMED AND MOTIVATED BY THE CHRISTIAN FAITH, BETHEL UNIVERSITY EDUCATES AND ENERGIZES MEN AND WOMEN FOR EXCELLENCE IN LEADERSHIP, SCHOLARSHIP AND SERVICE.
IRS990.Desc: EDUCATIONAL INSTRUCTION:COLLEGE OF ARTS & SCIENCES (LIBERAL ARTS, UNDERGRADUATE): 2,428 STUDENTS; GRADUATE SCHOOL AND COLLEGE OF ADULT & PROFESSIONAL STUDIES (ADULT DEGREE COMPLETION): 1,356 GRADUATE STUDENTS AND 631 UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS;BETHEL SEMINARY: 507 STUDENTS

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ACADEMIC SUPPORT SERVICES:SERVICES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: BETHEL UNIVERSITY LIBRARY, OFFICE OF UNIVERSITY REGISTRAR, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, HEALTH SERVICES, COUNSELING CENTER, AND ATHLETICS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY SERVICES:SERVICES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: STUDENT HOUSING (APPROXIMATELY 2/3 OF STUDENTS ARE IN BETHEL HOUSING), FOOD SERVICE, CAMPUS STORE.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: OTHER INCOME - 2017 AMOUNT: $ 104,551. SPECIAL EVENTS - 2018 AMOUNT: $ 27,890. 2019 AMOUNT: $ 27,600. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 14,001. 2021 AMOUNT: $ 22,844.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BETHEL UNIVERSITY IS A MEMBER OF THE MINNESOTA PRIVATE COLLEGE COUNCIL (MPCC), AN ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(4) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. MPCC IS AN ASSOCIATION OF PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION THAT SERVES A VARIETY OF ITS MEMBERS' SHARED NEEDS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT ONLY NONPARTISAN AND NON-ELECTORAL ADVOCACY FOR PUBLIC POLICY THAT MEETS STUDENTS' NEEDS AND ADVANCES THE INTERESTS OF PRIVATE HIGHER EDUCATION. BETHEL PAID MEMBERSHIP DUES TO MPCC IN THE AMOUNT OF $ 153,966.00 DURING THE FISCAL YEAR. BASED ON FIGURES PROVIDED BY MPCC, 100% OF BETHEL'S DUES WENT TOWARD LOBBYING.

BETHEL'S COLLECTIONS, WHICH WERE ACQUIRED THROUGH PURCHASES AND CONTRIBUTIONS SINCE BETHEL'S INCEPTION, ARE NOT RECOGNIZED AS ASSETS ON THE BALANCE SHEET. PURCHASES OF COLLECTION ITEMS ARE RECORDED AS DECREASES IN UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS IN THE YEAR IN WHICH THE ITEMS ARE ACQUIRED OR AS TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS IF THE ASSETS USED TO PURCHASE THE ITEMS ARE RESTRICTED BY DONORS. CONTRIBUTED COLLECTION ITEMS ARE NOT REFLECTED ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. PROCEEDS FROM DE-ACCESSIONS OR INSURANCE RECOVERIES ARE REFLECTED AS INCREASES IN THE APPROPRIATE NET ASSET CLASSES. BETHEL'S COLLECTIONS ARE MADE UP OF POTTERY, PRINTS, MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS, AND PAINTINGS THAT ARE HELD FOR EDUCATIONAL AND PERFORMANCE PURPOSES. EACH OF THE ITEMS ARE CATALOGED, PRESERVED AND CARED FOR, AND ACTIVITIES VERIFYING THEIR EXISTENCE AND ASSESSING THEIR CONDITION ARE PERFORMED CONTINUOUSLY.
ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS AS WELL AS TO SUPPORT PROGRAMS AND OPERATIONS.

BETHEL HAS RECEIVED A DETERMINATION LETTER FROM THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE INDICATING IT IS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS SUBJECT TO FEDERAL INCOME TAX ONLY ON NET UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. CONTRIBUTIONS ARE ALSO TAX DEDUCTIBLE. BETHEL HAS NO OBLIGATION FOR UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX. ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISIONS FOR FEDERAL OR STATE INCOME TAXES ARE REQUIRED. BETHEL FOLLOWS ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. THIS STANDARD CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTITY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ON A TAX RETURN THAT ARE NOT CERTAIN TO BE REALIZED.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 34,198. COST OF GOODS SOLD 994,242. CHANGE IN PENSION LIABILITY 4,285,858. CHANGE IN GIFT ANNUITIES -444,297. REVENUES REPORTED ON OTHER RETURN -1,740,437.
INSTITUTIONALLY FUNDED AID 39,151,178.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 34,198. COST OF GOODS SOLD 994,242.
INSTITUTIONALLY FUNDED AID 39,151,178.
THE POLICY IS PUBLISHED ON THE UNIVERSITY'S WEBSITE AND IN EMPLOYMENT, ADMISSIONS, AND REGISTRATION MATERIALS.
THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVES FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDS FOR THE PURPOSE OF GRANTS AND WORKSTUDY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BY REVIEWING STUDENT NEED BASED ON THE FAFSA REPORT, AWARDING BASED ON PRE-DETERMINED AID CRITERIA, AND MONITORING THE STUDENT STATUS EACH TERM.
ACCRUAL METHOD

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BY REVIEWING STUDENT NEED BASED ON THE FAFSA REPORT, AWARDING BASED ON PRE-DETERMINED AID CRITERIA, AND MONITORING THE STUDENT STATUS EACH TERM. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO REIMBURSES THE FOUNDATION FOR PAYROLL, AUDIT, AND OPERATIONAL EXPENSES DURING THE YEAR.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: PAYMENT TO THE COMPANY MEDIA MINEFIELD FOR MEDIA SERVICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE NUMBER IN COLUMN (B) IS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF THE BOARD CHAIR, VICE CHAIR, SECRETARY, TREASURER, ASSISTANT SECRETARY AND OTHER TRUSTEES AS SELECTED. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE HAS THE POWER AND AUTHORITY TO ACT AS DELEGATED BETWEEN BOARD MEETINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS OF THE UNIVERSITY INCLUDE REGULARLY ORGANIZED BAPTIST CHURCHES WHICH ARE MEMBERS IN GOOD STANDING OF THE CONVERGE ELECTED DELEGATES OF MEMBER CHURCHES, REGULARLY ELECTED MEMBERS OF THE CONVERGE BOARD, THE PRESIDENT OF THE CONFERENCE, THE OFFICERS OF THE BIENNIAL ASSEMBLY OF THE CONFERENCE, THE CHIEF ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER OF EACH CONFERENCE DISTRICT, THE PRESIDENT AND CHIEF ACADEMIC OFFICERS OF BETHEL UNIVERSITY, THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF BETHEL UNIVERSITY, AND THE DULY CONFIRMED FULL TIME FACULTY MEMBERS OF BETHEL SEMINARY SERVE AS DELEGATES TO THE BIENNIAL ASSEMBLY OF THE UNIVERSITY WITH VOICE AND VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A MAJORITY OF THE UNIVERSITY'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES ARE ELECTED BY THE DELEGATES AT THE BIENNIAL ASSEMBLY. ADDITIONAL BOARD TRUSTEES MAY BE APPOINTED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SUBJECT TO CONFIRMATION BY THE DELEGATES AT THE BIENNIAL ASSEMBLY. TWO REPRESENTATIVES OF THE DISTRICT EXECUTIVE MINISTERS COUNCIL ARE APPOINTED BY THE BOARD OF THE COUNCIL. THE PRESIDENT OF THE CONVERGE AND THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY SERVE AS EX-OFFICIO MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WITH VOTING RIGHTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AMENDMENTS TO THE UNIVERSITY'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, ITS AFFIRMATION OF FAITH, ELECTION AND/OR CONFIRMATION OF BOARD MEMBERS, ELECTION OF A PRESIDENT, CONFIRMATION OF THE PROVOST AND FULL TIME TEACHERS IN THE SEMINARY ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY THE DELEGATES OF THE UNIVERSITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM BASED ON DATA PROVIDED BY MANAGEMENT. ONCE A DRAFT OF THE FILING IS AVAILABLE, MANAGEMENT REVIEWS THE RETURN AND PROVIDES FEEDBACK ON CHANGES TO THE DOCUMENT. THE PUBLIC INSPECTION COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED FOR REVIEW TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS, INCLUDING THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY APPLIES TO TRUSTEES, GOVERNORS, OFFICERS, AND EMPLOYEES WHO INFLUENCE THE ACTIONS OF THE ORGANIZATION OR MAKE COMMITMENTS ON ITS BEHALF. ALL TRUSTEES, GOVERNORS AND OFFICERS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AND SIGN AN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE FORM. ALL INDIVIDUALS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST BEFORE A TRANSACTION IS CONSUMMATED. IF IT IS NOT CLEAR WHETHER AN EMPLOYEE HAS A CONFLICT, THE DECISION IS MADE BY THE RELEVANT SUPERVISOR - THE BOARD CHAIR, DEPARTMENT CHAIR, DEAN, VICE PRESIDENT OR PROVOST. IN THE CASE OF TRUSTEES, THE DECISION IS MADE BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. AN INDIVIDUAL WITH A POTENTIAL CONFLICT ABSTAINS FROM VOTING ON THE MATTER AND WITHDRAWS FROM ANY RELEVANT DISCUSSION. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES VOTES ON WHETHER THE TRANSACTION IS JUST, FAIR AND REASONABLE TO THE ORGANIZATION. THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING OF THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE SHALL REFLECT THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST WAS DISCLOSED AND THAT THE INTERESTED INDIVIDUAL WAS NOT PRESENT DURING THE FINAL DISCUSSION OR VOTE AND DID NOT VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT, OTHER OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED BY THE COMPENSATION AND PERFORMANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IN ACCORDANCE WITH ITS EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION POLICY, REVIEWING BENCHMARK DATA, UTILIZING THE METHODOLOGY OF THE REBUTTABLE PRESUMPTION OF REASONABLENESS TEST ESTABLISHED BY THE IRS, USING COMPENSATION ADVISERS, AND REVIEWING THE INDIVIDUALS PERFORMANCE. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST CONDUCTED IN 2020 FOR J. BARNES, PRESIDENT; J. ADDLEMAN, SPECIAL ASSISTANT TO THE PRESIDENT; J. BENDER, CHIEF ADVANCEMENT OFFICER; A. BLAZ, CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER; D. HARLESS, EX VP & PROVOST; M. POSNER, CHIEF FACILITIES AND TECHNOLOGY OFFICER; R. RIVERA, CHIEF DIVERSITY OFFICE; M. VEDDERS, CHIEF ENROLLMENT & MARKETING OFFICER; AND C. WALD CHIEF HUMAN RESOURCES AND STRATEGY OFFICER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN GIFT ANNUITIES -444,297. CHANGE IN PENSION LIABILITY 4,285,858.
THE PROCESS FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND SELECTION OF AN ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
